column5: Well, its been a couple of weeks since the season opened.  I was out for 5 days including the Monday-Wednesday after opening weekend and had a blast fishing the creeks with a crew I fish with every opener.  I've been busy as heck since, and finally have time to toss up a report.  2 of us headed up on the friday to set up camp and get things ready for our stay.  We hiked a couple of rivers that day and watched a few fish rising to BWOs, which got us pumped up for the following morning.  A few shots from the trip.                        Hatches are really starting to come off now.  Another couple of weeks and the mayflies will be out in full force!  Can't wait for that!  I spent a couple of days this past weekend in the same area doing some filming for an Ontario Fly Fishing documentary we are putting together.  Hopefully I'll have a couple of trailers for folks to check out in the next few weeks.  We've been filming since last november and have a ton of awesome footage.
Very nice shots and ya get a big   for not ruining the photos with ugly swirls!!!
Thanks Bud.  I hate those bloody swirls too.  If people would just set up their shots so they don't include any 'evidence' it would be much better!
Sweet report, I am very jealous . I have been out twice so far this year. Not much to show for it yet.  Can't wait to see that video.
very nice sized trout great fishing!!!   cheers
...i missed this one.  Great brownies man!!! It's the only brand of ontario trout we DON"T get up North. Geee they are purdy!
Great report, fish and pics fish_finder Thanks for sharing Leechman
Great pictures and some nice little fatties there. Thanks for sharing. I look forward to seeing your video footage.
There will be more very soon buddy!  The rain and T-storms expected this weekend should put the streams in great condition for next week with the hopes for some epic hendrickson hatches!
